intro: Haplophyllum poorei subsp. negevense, commonly known as the Negeven's haplophyllum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
